attributes.action: Create a ‘National Resilience Day’ Bank Holiday in October.
attributes.additional_details:
The National Resilience Day Holiday would remind us that we need to remain alert to the permanent risk of disaster and disease.  A recent report from the CEBR states that retail sales rise by 15% over a bank holiday, hospitality and catering by 20%. The ‘pent up’ demand resulting from current Covid-19 restrictions would amplify the effect.
The addition of a new and bring the UK a little closer to other G8 countries in terms of the number of annual holidays (we have 8 whilst the average is 12)
attributes.background: The new National Resilience Day bank holiday would serve to commemorate the loved ones we lost due to Covid-19 and honour the efforts of front-line workers who kept us safe during the height of the pandemic. It would also bring much needed support to tourism, hospitality and retail businesses.
